author: @achubutkin
description:
An extension for Yandex.Games SDK that lets you easily integrate games created by GDevelop into the Yandex.Games platform. The extension provides the following features:

* Set up automatic switching to full screen mode
* Set up screen orientation during the game and add a rotate device prompt
* In-game purchases
* Player details (user login, in-game data, user profile data)
* Game rating
* Manage ads (interstitial ad, rewarded videos)
* Competition tables
name: YandexGamesSDK
shortDescription: An extension for Yandex.Games SDK that lets you easily integrate games created by GDevelop into the Yandex.Games platform.

eventsFunctions.description:
Initialize the Yandex.Games SDK before getting started. Call this action only once in the game when it starts.

All other actions and conditions check that this SDK is initialized. You don't have to check it yourself every time.
eventsFunctions.name: Init
eventsFunctions.sentence: Initialize the Yandex.Games SDK (fullscreen: _PARAM1_, orientation: _PARAM2_, lock orientation: _PARAM3_)

parameters.description: Fullscreen (switch to full-screen mode when opening a game or on the first user action)
parameters.name: fullscreen

parameters.description: Screen orientation
parameters.name: orientation

parameters.description: Lock the orientation of the screen?
parameters.name: lock

eventsFunctions.description: The Yandex Games SDK initialized. All other actions and conditions check that this SDK is initialized. You don't have to check it yourself every time.

eventsFunctions.description:
To work with the user's in-game data, use the action. 

When the Player object is initialized, the player sees a dialog window requesting access to their personal data. Access is requested for the avatar and username, the user ID is always passed automatically.

If you only need the ID and not the username or avatar, use the optional scopes: false parameter. In this case, the dialog window isn't shown.
eventsFunctions.name: InitPlayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Init player with scopes _PARAM1_ and signed _PARAM2_ and open auth dialog _PARAM3_ and photo size _PARAM4_

parameters.name: Scopes

parameters.description: Signed
parameters.name: Signed

parameters.description: Open auth dialog if user not logged in?
parameters.name: OpenAuthDialog

parameters.description: Photo size of user`s avatar
parameters.name: PhotoSize

eventsFunctions.description:
To allow users to make in-game purchases. Only users logged in to Yandex can make in-game purchases, otherwise the purchase data isn't saved.

User must be initialized before calling this action with action InitPlayer.

eventsFunctions.description:
Load a user's purchase by ID or process consumable purchases.

There are two types of purchases: permanent (such as for disabling ads) and consumable (such as in-game currency).

To process permanent purchases, just use the action.
To process consumable purchases, use the action and the Process the consumable purchases option.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadPlayerPurchaseByID
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load the purchase by ID _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: The purchase (product) ID (e.g. "disable_ads")
parameters.name: PurchaseID

parameters.description: Global structure variable where to store loaded purchases
parameters.name: ResultVariableName

parameters.description: Process the consumable purchases
parameters.longDescription:
There are two types of purchases: permanent (such as for disabling ads) and consumable (such as in-game currency).

To process permanent purchases, set this option to No.
To process consumable purchases, set this option to Yes (Attention! After run this action, the processed purchase is permanently deleted. Therefore, first edit the player data using the Save Player Data or Save Player Stats action and then process the purchase.
parameters.name: ProcessTheConsumablePurchases

parameters.description: Global variable where to store the variable with state (ok or error)
parameters.name: CallbackVariableName

eventsFunctions.fullName: Load player`s purchase by ID succeeded

eventsFunctions.sentence: Load player`s purchase by ID failed

eventsFunctions.description:
Activate an in-game purchase. The action opens a frame with a payment gateway.

After the player successfully makes a purchase, check it with the PurchaseSucceeded condition. If the player didn't make a purchase and closed the window, check it with the PurchaseFailed condition.
eventsFunctions.name: Purchase

parameters.description: The purchase (product) ID (e.g. "disable_ads")
parameters.name: PurchaseID

parameters.description: Global structure variable where to store the loaded purchase data
parameters.name: ResultVariableName

parameters.description: Global variable where to store the variable with state (ok or error)
parameters.name: CallbackVariableName

eventsFunctions.description: Checking for the player successfully makes a purchase.
eventsFunctions.name: PurchaseSucceeded

parameters.description: The purchase (product) ID (optional, e.g. "disable_ads", when not set then last purchase will be check)
parameters.name: PurchaseID

eventsFunctions.description:
Checking for an error occurrs.

An unstable internet connection may cause a situation where the player makes a purchase, but it's not registered in the game. To avoid this, process purchases using the ConsumePurchase action.
eventsFunctions.name: PurchaseFailed

parameters.description: The purchase (product) ID (optional, e.g. "disable_ads", when not set then last purchase will be check)
parameters.name: PurchaseID
